BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of new snow and strong wind the prevalence and size of the avalanche prone locations will increase as the day progresses.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
Above approximately 1500 m snow will fall on Thursday. The wind will be strong in particular along the border with France.
As a consequence of new snow and a moderate to strong wind from westerly directions, sometimes large wind slabs will form from late morning.
The fresh snow as well as the wind slabs represent the main danger. The prevalence of avalanche prone locations and likelihood of triggering will increase with altitude. These avalanche prone locations are to be found also on steep slopes and in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain. They are numerous and are barely recognisable because of the poor visibility.
Along the border with Switzerland and along the border with France the avalanche prone locations are more widespread.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
20 to 50 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, will fall above approximately 2000 m.
The cold fresh snow as well as the wind slabs will be deposited on a favourable old snowpack in all aspects.
At low and intermediate altitudes only a little snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The danger of natural avalanches will decrease gradually.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of new snow and strong wind the prevalence and size of the avalanche prone locations will increase as the day progresses.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
Above approximately 1500 m snow will fall on Thursday. The wind will be strong in particular along the border with France.
As a consequence of new snow and a moderate to strong wind from westerly directions, sometimes large wind slabs will form from late morning.
The fresh snow as well as the wind slabs represent the main danger. The prevalence of avalanche prone locations and likelihood of triggering will increase with altitude. These avalanche prone locations are to be found also on steep slopes and in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain. They are numerous and are barely recognisable because of the poor visibility.
Along the border with Switzerland and along the border with France the avalanche prone locations are more widespread.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
20 to 50 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, will fall above approximately 2000 m.
The cold fresh snow as well as the wind slabs will be deposited on a favourable old snowpack in all aspects.
At low and intermediate altitudes only a little snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The danger of natural avalanches will decrease gradually.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of the precipitation the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent from midday.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
Some snow has fallen since Monday along the border with Switzerland. The wind was moderate to strong in the vicinity of peaks.
The fresh and somewhat older wind slabs can be released, especially by large additional loads, in particular on northwest to east to southeast facing aspects and generally at intermediate and high altitudes. They are to be found especially adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas.

Above approximately 1200 m snow will fall from early morning. In these regions the avalanche danger will increase gradually. Caution is to be exercised in particular above the tree line.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Along the border with Switzerland some new snow. In some localities up to 15 cm of snow has fallen since Monday above approximately 2000 m. The northwesterly wind has transported the new snow significantly. In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust. The old snowpack will be generally stable.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Increase in danger of dry avalanches as the precipitation becomes more intense.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of the precipitation the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent from midday.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
Some snow has fallen since Monday along the border with Switzerland. The wind was moderate to strong in the vicinity of peaks.
The fresh and somewhat older wind slabs can be released, especially by large additional loads, in particular on northwest to east to southeast facing aspects and generally at intermediate and high altitudes. They are to be found especially adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas.

Above approximately 1200 m snow will fall from early morning. In these regions the avalanche danger will increase gradually. Caution is to be exercised in particular above the tree line.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Along the border with Switzerland some new snow. In some localities up to 15 cm of snow has fallen since Monday above approximately 2000 m. The northwesterly wind has transported the new snow significantly. In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust. The old snowpack will be generally stable.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Increase in danger of dry avalanches as the precipitation becomes more intense.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Increase in avalanche danger as a consequence of the precipitation.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The number and size of avalanche prone locations will increase as the day progresses. In all aspects medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large avalanches are possible as a consequence of the precipitation.
The new snow and wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in all aspects.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: As a consequence of snowfall and the strong southwesterly wind, snow drift accumulations will form. Large quantities of fresh snow and the wind-drifted snow are bonding poorly with the old snowpack in all aspects.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Over a wide area intensive precipitation. Strong southwesterly wind.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Increase in avalanche danger as a consequence of the precipitation.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The number and size of avalanche prone locations will increase as the day progresses. In all aspects medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large avalanches are possible as a consequence of the precipitation.
The new snow and wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in all aspects.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: As a consequence of snowfall and the strong southwesterly wind, snow drift accumulations will form. Large quantities of fresh snow and the wind-drifted snow are bonding poorly with the old snowpack in all aspects.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Over a wide area intensive precipitation. Strong southwesterly wind.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of the precipitation the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent from midday.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The mostly small wind slabs can be released in isolated cases, but mostly only by large additional loads,. This applies in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas in particular at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions.

Above approximately 1500 m snow will fall from early morning. In these regions the avalanche danger will increase gradually to level 2 (moderate). Caution is to be exercised in particular above the tree line.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The weather conditions gave rise to rapid consolidation of the snowpack. In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust.
In isolated cases wind slabs are lying on old snow containing large grains. This applies especially on shady slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Increase in danger of dry avalanches as the snowfall becomes more intense.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of the precipitation the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent from midday.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The mostly small wind slabs can be released in isolated cases, but mostly only by large additional loads,. This applies in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas in particular at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions.

Above approximately 1500 m snow will fall from early morning. In these regions the avalanche danger will increase gradually to level 2 (moderate). Caution is to be exercised in particular above the tree line.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The weather conditions gave rise to rapid consolidation of the snowpack. In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust.
In isolated cases wind slabs are lying on old snow containing large grains. This applies especially on shady slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Increase in danger of dry avalanches as the snowfall becomes more intense.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The mostly small wind slabs of the last few days represent the main danger.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Wind slabs can in some places be released, even by a single winter sport participant, especially on very steep slopes above approximately 2500 m. These avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain. In very isolated cases dry avalanches can also be released in the old snowpack. Mostly avalanches are rather small.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
As a consequence of a moderate to strong wind, sometimes easily released wind slabs formed in the last few days. Some fresh snow and in particular the mostly small wind slabs must be evaluated with care and prudence.
Sunshine and high temperatures gave rise to increasing and thorough wetting of the snowpack over a wide area below approximately 2400 m.
The snowpack remains subject to considerable local variations.
At low and intermediate altitudes only a little snow is lying. Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be severely restricted. The snowpack consists of faceted crystals and its surface has a crust that is strong in many cases. There is a danger of falling here.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: On Friday as a consequence of new snow and strong wind there will be a significant increase in the danger of dry avalanches.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Fresh wind slabs require caution.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
During the day: As a consequence of new snow and a sometimes strong southwesterly wind, further wind slabs will form. The fresh wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in particular on steep shady slopes above approximately 2400 m. Avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain. The prevalence of the avalanche prone locations will increase with altitude. In some cases avalanches are medium-sized.

In very isolated cases dry avalanches can also be released in the old snowpack. This applies in particular on the Main Alpine Ridge and to the south. Avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in little used terrain above approximately 2400 m, especially on very steep shady slopes.

On very steep grassy slopes only isolated gliding avalanches are possible below approximately 2400 m.

Evening and first half of night: Increase in danger of dry avalanches as the snowfall becomes more intense, in particular on steep shady slopes at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
In some localities up to 10 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, will fall on Thursday above approximately 1500 m, especially in the evening.

The new snow and wind slabs are lying on a crust in all aspects below approximately 2200 m. Especially shady slopes above approximately 2400 m: The new snow and wind slabs are lying on soft layers.

The old snowpack remains subject to considerable local variations at high altitude. Within the snowpack, there are multiple melt-freeze crusts sandwiches with faceted layers in between, in particular on steep sunny slopes in all altitude zones, as well as on shady slopes below approximately 2600 m.

At low and intermediate altitudes only a little snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment:
Significant increase in avalanche danger as a consequence of new snow and wind. Over a wide area 20 to 40 cm of snow will fall on Friday above approximately 1500 m. Especially from the Passeier Tal to the Southern Zillertal Alps and High Tauern up to 70 cm of snow will fall. More frequent natural dry avalanches are to be expected, even large ones in isolated cases, especially on steep shady slopes at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation.
As a consequence of the snowfall, the likelihood of gliding avalanches being released will increase gradually in particular on steep grassy slopes at intermediate and high altitudes.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of new snow and wind the prevalence and size of the avalanche prone locations will increase as the day progresses.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
Above approximately 1500 m snow will fall on Thursday. The wind will be moderate at times.
As a consequence of new snow and a light to moderate wind from westerly directions, mostly small wind slabs will form from late morning.
The fresh snow as well as the wind slabs represent the main danger. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on very steep slopes and in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain. They are barely recognisable because of the poor visibility.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
15 to 30 cm of snow will fall above approximately 2000 m.
The fresh snow as well as the mostly small wind slabs will be deposited on a favourable old snowpack in all aspects. At low and intermediate altitudes only a little snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The danger of natural avalanches will decrease gradually.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of new snow and wind the prevalence and size of the avalanche prone locations will increase as the day progresses.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
Above approximately 1500 m snow will fall on Thursday. The wind will be moderate at times.
As a consequence of new snow and a light to moderate wind from westerly directions, mostly small wind slabs will form from late morning.
The fresh snow as well as the wind slabs represent the main danger. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on very steep slopes and in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain. They are barely recognisable because of the poor visibility.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
15 to 30 cm of snow will fall above approximately 2000 m.
The fresh snow as well as the mostly small wind slabs will be deposited on a favourable old snowpack in all aspects. At low and intermediate altitudes only a little snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The danger of natural avalanches will decrease gradually.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Increase in avalanche danger in the evening.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
During the day: As a consequence of new snow and a sometimes strong southwesterly wind, mostly small wind slabs will form. The fresh wind slabs can in very isolated cases be released, even by a single winter sport participant, especially on very steep shady slopes above approximately 2600 m. These avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain. The prevalence of the avalanche prone locations will increase with altitude. In very isolated cases dry avalanches can also be released in the old snowpack. Avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in little used terrain above approximately 2400 m, especially on very steep shady slopes. Mostly avalanches are small.

Only isolated gliding avalanches are possible.

Evening and first half of night: Increase in danger of dry avalanches as the snowfall becomes more intense, in particular on steep shady slopes at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
In some localities up to 10 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, will fall on Thursday above approximately 1500 m, especially in the evening.

The snowpack remains subject to considerable local variations. Within the snowpack, there are multiple melt-freeze crusts sandwiches with faceted layers in between, in particular on steep sunny slopes in all altitude zones, as well as on shady slopes below approximately 2600 m.

At intermediate altitudes only a little snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment:
Significant increase in avalanche danger as a consequence of new snow and wind. Over a wide area 20 to 40 cm of snow will fall on Friday above approximately 1500 m. Especially from the Ortler Range via the Passeier Tal to the Southern Zillertal Alps and High Tauern up to 70 cm of snow will fall. More frequent natural dry avalanches are to be expected, even large ones in isolated cases, especially on steep shady slopes at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation.
As a consequence of the snowfall, the likelihood of gliding avalanches being released will increase gradually in particular on steep grassy slopes at intermediate and high altitudes.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Increase in avalanche danger in the evening.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
During the day: As a consequence of new snow and a sometimes strong southwesterly wind, mostly small wind slabs will form. The fresh wind slabs can in very isolated cases be released, even by a single winter sport participant, especially on very steep shady slopes above approximately 2600 m. These avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain. The prevalence of the avalanche prone locations will increase with altitude. In very isolated cases dry avalanches can also be released in the old snowpack. Avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in little used terrain above approximately 2400 m, especially on very steep shady slopes. Mostly avalanches are small.

Only isolated gliding avalanches are possible.

Evening and first half of night: Increase in danger of dry avalanches as the snowfall becomes more intense, in particular on steep shady slopes at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
In some localities up to 10 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, will fall on Thursday above approximately 1500 m, especially in the evening.

The snowpack remains subject to considerable local variations. Within the snowpack, there are multiple melt-freeze crusts sandwiches with faceted layers in between, in particular on steep sunny slopes in all altitude zones, as well as on shady slopes below approximately 2600 m.

At intermediate altitudes only a little snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment:
Significant increase in avalanche danger as a consequence of new snow and wind. Over a wide area 20 to 40 cm of snow will fall on Friday above approximately 1500 m. Especially from the Ortler Range via the Passeier Tal to the Southern Zillertal Alps and High Tauern up to 70 cm of snow will fall. More frequent natural dry avalanches are to be expected, even large ones in isolated cases, especially on steep shady slopes at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation.
As a consequence of the snowfall, the likelihood of gliding avalanches being released will increase gradually in particular on steep grassy slopes at intermediate and high altitudes.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of the precipitation the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent from midday.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The mostly small wind slabs can be released in isolated cases, but mostly only by large additional loads,. This applies in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas in particular at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions. Apart from the danger of being buried, restraint should be exercised in particular in view of the danger of avalanches sweeping people along and giving rise to falls.

Some snow will fall from midday over a wide area. The avalanche danger will increase during the day, reaching danger level 2 (moderate). This applies in particular at intermediate and high altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The weather conditions gave rise to rapid consolidation of the snowpack.
In isolated cases wind slabs are lying on old snow containing large grains. This applies especially on shady slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Increase in danger of dry avalanches as the precipitation becomes more intense.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of the precipitation the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent from midday.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The mostly small wind slabs can be released in isolated cases, but mostly only by large additional loads,. This applies in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas in particular at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions. Apart from the danger of being buried, restraint should be exercised in particular in view of the danger of avalanches sweeping people along and giving rise to falls.

Some snow will fall from midday over a wide area. The avalanche danger will increase during the day, reaching danger level 2 (moderate). This applies in particular at intermediate and high altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The weather conditions gave rise to rapid consolidation of the snowpack.
In isolated cases wind slabs are lying on old snow containing large grains. This applies especially on shady slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Increase in danger of dry avalanches as the precipitation becomes more intense.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Increase in avalanche danger as a consequence of the precipitation.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The number and size of avalanche prone locations will increase as the day progresses. In particular adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas small and medium-sized avalanches are possible as a consequence of the precipitation.
The new snow and wind slabs can be released, especially by large additional loads, in all aspects.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: As a consequence of snowfall and the strong southwesterly wind, fresh snow drift accumulations will form. The new snow and wind slabs will be deposited on the unfavourable surface of an old snowpack in particular on shady slopes above approximately 1800 m.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Over a wide area intensive precipitation. Strong southwesterly wind.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Increase in avalanche danger as a consequence of the precipitation.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The number and size of avalanche prone locations will increase as the day progresses. In particular adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas small and medium-sized avalanches are possible as a consequence of the precipitation.
The new snow and wind slabs can be released, especially by large additional loads, in all aspects.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: As a consequence of snowfall and the strong southwesterly wind, fresh snow drift accumulations will form. The new snow and wind slabs will be deposited on the unfavourable surface of an old snowpack in particular on shady slopes above approximately 1800 m.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Over a wide area intensive precipitation. Strong southwesterly wind.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Weakly bonded old snow is to be evaluated with care and prudence.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Individual mostly small avalanches are possible above approximately 1800 m. This applies especially in gullies and bowls.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The old snowpack remains subject to considerable local variations. At high altitude only a little snow is lying. At high altitude mostly small wind slabs formed. In gullies and bowls the wind slabs are larger.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Individual avalanche prone locations are to be found at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions and on very steep slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
Little snow will fall on Thursday. The wind will be moderate at times.
As a consequence of new snow and a light to moderate wind from westerly directions, small wind slabs will form from late morning.
These can in isolated cases be released by people. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on very steep slopes.
Restraint should be exercised because avalanches can sweep people along and give rise to falls.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
10 to 20 cm of snow will fall above approximately 2000 m.
The old snowpack will be in most cases well bonded.
At low and intermediate altitudes only a little snow is lying.
Snow depths vary greatly at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions, depending on the infuence of the wind.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Weak layers in the old snowpack necessitate caution.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Weak layers in the old snowpack can be released by large additional loads in particular on very steep northwest, north and northeast facing slopes. Weak layers in the old snowpack necessitate caution. The weather was mild over a wide area. The more recent wind slabs are to be found in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls and generally at high altitudes. They can be released by large loads.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Weak layers exist in the snowpack in particular on northwest, north and northeast facing slopes. The snowpack will be in some cases moist.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Down to 1700 m snow will fall over a wide area.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The snowpack will be in most cases well bonded.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The mostly small wind slabs can be released in isolated cases, but mostly only by large additional loads,. This applies in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas in particular at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions. Apart from the danger of being buried, restraint should be exercised in particular in view of the danger of avalanches sweeping people along and giving rise to falls.

Some snow will fall from midday over a wide area. The avalanche danger will increase a little during the day.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The weather conditions gave rise to rapid consolidation of the snowpack.
In isolated cases wind slabs are lying on old snow containing large grains. This applies especially on shady slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: In some regions increase in danger of dry avalanches as a consequence of the snowfall.
